etymology.description: 运(運 ‘to transport; move’) + 动(動 ‘move; put into action’) = motion; physical activity (exercise; sports).
etymology.interpretation: Combines initiating/setting in motion with movement to express ongoing motion. In modern usage it refers both to bodily exercise and organized sports.
etymology.simplification: Both characters were simplified to reduce strokes while keeping key motion cues: 运 replaces complex 軍 with simple 云 above the ‘walk’ radical 辶; 动 streamlines 動 by simplifying 重 above 力, preserving the idea of force in motion.

parts.english: to transport; to move; to run/operate; luck/fortune
to move; to stir; to affect; to use/exert

examples.chinese: 我每天早上去公园运动(我每天早上去公園運動)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān zǎoshang qù gōngyuán yùndòng.
examples.english: I exercise in the park every morning.

examples.chinese: 这项运动很受欢迎(這項運動很受歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè xiàng yùndòng hěn shòu huānyíng.

examples.chinese: 适量的运动有益健康(適量的運動有益健康)。
